messages.title: What do you want from the people who run this country?
messages.content: I want a government that really helps people to get a good start in life. A government committed to increasing job opportunities in Richmond Park and North Kingston and helping people to get on in life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Delivered an £800 income tax cut for 53,1000 working people here – something the Conservatives said back in 2010 wouldn't be possible.

Stopped the Tories pulling us out of Europe – our local Conservative MP is on the very edge of supporting pulling his party, and the country, out of the European Union which would be a calamity for a generation of young people who rely on the prosperity and investment being part of the EU brings.
Protected the NHS budget – last year the Lib Dems ensured there was an extra £2 billion for frontline NHS services.

Up to one in four young people in Britain suffer from some form of mental illness – and for too long that hasn’t been taken seriously. That’s why the Lib Dems have pledged an extra £500 million nationwide to tackling problems with mental health.

issues.health: With your help we can continue to fight to make sure everyone in the UK has a good start in life, including investing a further £8 billion in the next Parliament.

images.caption: Robin Meltzer, Lib Dem candidate for Richmond, North Kingston and New Malden
